meanings.definition: To make into a drama or play.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys dramatising stories for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The students are dramatising a famous play for the school play.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist dramatising his trip to the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was dramatising the ordinary into something extraordinary.
meanings.sent5: The children were dramatising their favorite fairy tale with great enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate or make something seem more dramatic than it really is.
meanings.sent1: Stop dramatising the situation; it's not as bad as you think.
meanings.sent2: She has a habit of dramatising every little problem she faces.
meanings.sent3: He was dramatising his fear of spiders by jumping on the chair.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor was dramatising the weather forecast to grab attention.
meanings.sent5: The author was dramatising the character's emotions to evoke strong reactions from readers.
